comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3420) (MYAIR-3835)
# 1. When the patient goes to the coaching section for the first time on a given phone then Monte Carlo shall ask the patient for permission to enable push notifications
# Note 1: Use myAir Support website with Admin Credentials to check the Notification Status. ( https://mcsupport.hawkesbury.int/Default.aspx  )
# Note 2: It is assumed that the Android default of having App notifications enabled has not been changed by the user

# Note 3: When testing manually, after the test steps, sign into the support website from Note 1, and check that the push token is there if the scenario has enabled push notifications. If the scenario has not enabled push notifications, the push token should not be there.
# Note 4: If the patient chooses to enable push notifications then both Coaching and Cleaning Reminder push notifications are to be enabled.

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: After installing the app, go to the "Coaching" screen, enable push notifications and verify the system dialog to request permission displays

steps.name: notifications are disabled in System settings
I press the "Home" device button
I open the app
I navigate to the "Coaching" screen
I should see the "Push notifications permission" dialog
I tap the "Allow" button
I should see the "Push notifications system" dialog
I tap the "Settings" button
I should be on the "App notification settings" screen
I "enable" notifications for the app on the device
I press "Back"
I should see the "Push notifications are now enabled" dialog
the Push token has been uploaded to Patient Portal

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2622) (MYAIR-3444)
# 1. If the user selects a navigation tab that has a badge icon, then Monte Carlo shall execute the push notification associated with the tab badge icon.
# Note: Score tip push notification does no action. Coaching tip or Sleep library push notification updates the appropriate section and auto-navigates user to appropriate media asset.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2623) (MYAIR-3374)
# 1. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a coaching tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 2. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a sleep library push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 3. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the coaching tab and the coaching tab is pressed, then the badge shall be removed
# 4. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a score tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the dashboard tab
# 5. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the dashboard tab and the dashboard tab is pressed or on App launch, then the badge shall be removed
# 6. Given Monte Carlo has tab badge icons when App is closed (user or OS closed), then the previous tab badge icons shall be shown when App is re-launched.
# Note: When Monte Carlo is in foreground and a push notification is received, the push will NOT show up in system tray; it will only result in the push's associated navigation tab being badged.
# Note: For android use this command to get the Token = adb logcat -v time | grep Refreshed
# Note: For android use this command to get the AccountIdentifier = adb logcat -v time | egrep AccountIdentifier
#ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MYAIR-3528) (MCA-2521)
# 1. When App receives a push notification, regardless if App is in foreground or background, then a badge shall be shown on the App launch icon.
# 2. The badge on the App launch icon shall persist as long as there are outstanding push notifications to be actioned by user.

# Note: When App is in the background and a push notification is received the push notification details are displayed in the system tray.  When a user opens the App, regardless if opened by App Icon or system tray push notification, the App Icon badge is removed and all system tray push notifications are cleared (i.e. no longer outstanding)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled
notifications are enabled in System settings
existing badge icon on "Dashboard" tab has been removed
existing badge icon on "Coaching" tab has been removed

elements.name: Verify the badge icon appears over the dashboard tab following a "Score tip" push notification when on the Settings, and removed when navigating to the "Dashboard" screen

steps.name: I open the app on the "Profile" screen
a "ScoreTip" push notification is received
I should see a badge icon on the "Dashboard" tab
I tap the "Dashboard" tab
I should be on the "Dashboard" screen
I should not see a badge icon on the "Dashboard" tab

name: Show badge icon when new data is received from patient portal or from coaching tip push notification

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-510) (MYAIR-3128)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall provide a method to contact support
# 2. The user shall be able to select a category, subcategory and question for the help request
# 3. When the user has selected a category, subcategory and question, Monte Carlo shall provide a link to the relevant support section.
# 4. The user shall be able to enter a description for the help request
# 5. The description shall be limited to 400 characters
# 6. When the user has chosen a category, subcategory, question, and written at least one character in the description, they shall be able to submit the help request
# 7. When the user has submitted the help request, Monte Carlo shall send the user's help request, first name, email address and FG serial number to Patient Portal
# Note: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/Support+screen+improvement
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-1636) (MYAIR-2015)
# 1. If a user selects a clinically related question in the support form, then they will be shown a message to contact their care provider
# note: this behaviour is because the support service can not answer treatment or therapy related queries.
# https://confluence.ec2.local/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=39259556

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Monte Carlo shall provide a method to contact support and have various options to select from Category

steps.name: I open the app on the "Settings" screen
I tap the "myAir Support" item
I should be on the "myAir Support" screen
I tap the "contact myAir support" item
I should be on the "Contact support" screen
there should be the option "Account" in the "Category" field
there should be the option "Data" in the "Category" field
there should be the option "Equipment" in the "Category" field
there should be the option "Library" in the "Category" field
there should be the option "Security" in the "Category" field
there should be the option "Treatment" in the "Category" field

I wait for network sync

I should see the "Server error" dialog

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3537) (MYAIR-3930)
#  1.  Given the patient is signed-in and already has a device registered with their account, then the App shall allow the patient to change the device registered with their account
#  Note: See MCA-3536 for device registration requirements
# For testing Use these Values:
#    Existing Account : test.resmed11+139@gmail.com / Resmed123  (Default Device = 69362761035 )
#    Updated Device Serial : 56855204271
# V5 Patient Portal Endpoints : https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/V5+Patient+Portal+Endpoints
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3002)(MCA-2536)
# 1. If the user has an AirSense in their account, then Monte Carlo shall display the last sync time for that machine that is provided by Patient Portal
# 2. In the event Patient Portal returns last sync time as "1900-01-01T00:00:00.000Z" then Monte Carlo shall display the last sync time for that machine as "-"
# Note 1: By default the App displays "-" for last sync time (i.e. sync has yet to occur).
# Note 2: Example format for displaying last sync time is Jan 12, 1952 3:30 PM
# Note 3: Date and time is based on the phone's local date and time
# Note:  All the test scenarios in this feature file require usage of the Patient Portal server
# Mock uses the following serial numbers / devices numbers / make / models for responses
# | Serial Number | Device Number | Made By            | Model                          | Notes                 |
# | 78899898308   | 564           | ResMed             | AirSense 10 Autoset            | * Default in mock     |
# | 56221828959   | 564           | ResMed             | AirSense 10 AutoSet for Her    |                       |

steps.name: I enable Wifi
I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Patient attempts to update the Device by providing a serial number and a device number for the FG that is already in use, then the app informs the user that the device cannot be updated

steps.name: I open the app on the "My equipment" screen
I tap the "Update machine" button
I should be on the "Update machine" screen
I enter "22343453908" into the "Serial number" field
I enter "107" into the "Device number" field
Patient Portal will return a "15" response error code
I tap the "Save" button
I should be on the "Update machine" screen
I should see the text "The serial number and/or the device number entered is not valid. Please try again."

arguments.val: The serial number and/or the device number entered is not valid. Please try again.

name: View and update personal details in profile
description:
(MCA-164)
(MYAIR-2958)
As a patient
I want to update my profile
so that my Monte Carlo experience is personalised.

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3350) (MYAIR-3791)
#1.  When a forthcoming scheduled maintenance outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient of the impending server outage
#2.  When a scheduled maintenance outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient the server is down for scheduled maintenance
#3.  When an unscheduled partial outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient the server is experiencing issues
#Note 1: Occurs when AVX is down but Patient Portal is online
#4.  When an unscheduled outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient the server is experiencing issues
#Note 2: Occurs when Patient Portal is down or Patient Portal is unable to process App service request because AVX is down
#  Server notifies App of planned/unplanned outage, 4 different UI dialogs can appear for the 7 possible scenarios:
#  Dialog #1 (planned active)
#  1) PP planned outage active
#  2) AV planned outage active
#  Note: string supplied by server endpoint
#  Dialog #2 (partial outage)
#  3) AV unplanned outage
#  Note: string supplied by server endpoint
#  Dialog #3 (total outage)
#  4) PP unplanned outage
#  5) AV unplanned outage which prevents PP from completing any part of request
#  Note: string hard-coded in App
#  Dialog #4 (planned upcoming)
#  6) PP planned outage upcoming
#  7) AV planned outage upcoming
#  Note: string supplied by server endpoint
# Notes: For Android testing purposes use these to generate the Outages
#AC 1: Dialog 4: Planned outage Upcoming - Scheduled Full Outage / Scheduled Partial Outage
#AC 2: Dialog 1: Planned Active Outage - Active Partial Outage
#AC 3: Dialog 2: Unplanned Partial Outage - Active Partial Outage
#AC 4: Dialog 3: Unplanned Total Outage - Active Full Outage (this is just 503/404 HTTP Response )
# Reference page: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MYAIR/Monaco+Interface+with+Patient+Portal#MonacoInterfacewithPatientPortal-ServerOutages

Patient Portal has a "unplanned full" active outage
it has been "301" seconds since data sync
I navigate to the "Dashboard" screen
I should be on the "Total outage" screen

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2391) (MYAIR-3111)
# 1.The patient shall be able to view their sleep score and score breakdown for the most recent 30 nights, up to and including the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "Last night".
# 2. The data available to the user shall be displayed in reverse chronological order.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.
# Note 3: "previous nights" includes sleep records with no data or zero usage
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2442) (MYAIR-453)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall not display the sleep score on the dashboard when there is no data for the sleep record.
# 2. The usage, mask leak, events per Hour, and Mask on/off events values and scores will be replaced with a dash.
# Note 1: This dashboard appears when there is no patient data available.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2443) (MYAIR-697)
# 1. When the user navigates to the Dashboard, on launch and by selecting the Dashboard menu item, the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night" shall be displayed by Monte Carlo.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.

steps.name: all sleep data is cleared
I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: You cannot navigate forward from the most recent night

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I navigate to the most recent sleep record
I see the score for most recent sleep record
I cannot go 1 sleep record forward

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2391) (MYAIR-3111)
# 1.The patient shall be able to view their sleep score and score breakdown for the most recent 30 nights, up to and including the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "Last night".
# 2. The data available to the user shall be displayed in reverse chronological order.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.
# Note 3: "previous nights" includes sleep records with no data or zero usage
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2442) (MYAIR-453)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall not display the sleep score on the dashboard when there is no data for the sleep record.
# 2. The usage, mask leak, events per Hour, and Mask on/off events values and scores will be replaced with a dash.
# Note 1: This dashboard appears when there is no patient data available.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2443) (MYAIR-697)
# 1. When the user navigates to the Dashboard, on launch and by selecting the Dashboard menu item, the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night" shall be displayed by Monte Carlo.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.

steps.name: all sleep data is cleared
I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify patient is able to view data from 30 previous nights and they are displayed in reverse chronological order

steps.name: I have "31" days of sleep data
I navigate to the "Dashboard" screen
I tap the "Sleep Day" field
I should see the last 30 dates in sleep day list
the sleep day list are in reverse chronological order

name: Sleep Record Navigation and display default sleep record

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-1284)

# 1. Given the system Push setting has changed since Monte Carlo was last in the foreground, when Monte Carlo is launched or opened, Monte Carlo shall update Patient Portal with the Push status and token
# 2. Given Push is enabled in the system settings, when the push setting is changed in the profile, Monte Carlo shall update Patient Portal with the Push status and token
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-804)

#  1. Given the Push token has been updated or not previously sent to Patient Portal, when Monte Carlo is launched or opened and user is logged-in, Monte Carlo shall send the Push token to Patient Portal
#  2. Given App Notifications are turned on in the phone settings, when the push setting is changed in the profile, Monte Carlo shall update Patient Portal with the app Push setting and token
# Note for Android: Use this command to validate that the token is the same as the patient portal support:   adb logcat -v time | egrep "Refreshed token:"
# Note 1: Use myAir Support website with Admin Credentials to check the Notification Status. (   https://mcsupport.hawkesbury.int/Default.aspx  )
# Note 2: Only "Android": "Push token is updated on the app" - To Trigger >> Test Support >> test actions >> refresh firebase token

# Note 3: When testing manually: to verify that the Push Token is sent to Patient Portal, sign into the support site from Note 1, and check that the push token for the device used in the test is listed.

steps.name: notifications are enabled in System settings
I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "My notifications" screen

comments.value: # Please see Note 2
# The push token received on the myAir Support Website should be the same seen on the logcat for android ( adb logcat -v time | egrep "Refreshed token:" )

elements.name: Verify that when the App notifications are turned ON in the phone Settings and when the push notifications on the app is updated, the push token and status should be updated on Patient Portal Support

steps.name: I toggle the "Push notifications Coaching" switch on
the Push token has been uploaded to Patient Portal
the Push token is updated on the app
the Push token has been uploaded to Patient Portal

name: Update Push Status with Patient Portal
